data.title: Chocoholics Must Experience
data.text: The chocolate cafe is chocolate heaven. If you love chocolate, or if you even like chocolate, you should definitely go. The cakes are ginormous. The ice cream is divine. If I drank coffee, I'd probably love it too.

data.title: Great Desserts
data.text: Location is great. Visit the Memorial while you are there. Friendly staff. Nice seating area outside. Have more than just candy. Coffee, Water, Ice Cream.

data.title: Amazing!
data.text: Every time my sister visits, we go to the chocolate cafe. We have gotten coffee, ice cream, and a ridiculous assortment of cakes and pies here. Every single thing we have had here is fantastic. Sometimes we get so much that we feel a little chocolate-logged after (like water-logged--get it?). Their stuff is so rich! If you love chocolate, this is the place for you! And who doesn't love an excuse to stroll around monument circle?

data.title: Good Chocolate, Great Ice Cream
data.text: The chocolate was just average. But, we went back that night and the ice cream was fantastic. They were understaffed. But, the staff that was there was very friendly. Unfortunately, the staffing led to a dirty store.

data.title: Disappointing desserts for the price
data.text: The desserts are beautiful but they don't taste as great as they look.  The six layer chocolate cake was dry and had a bland flavor and then cost $10.00!  The ice cream was good but overpriced.  Lastly the cheesecake did not live up to the price tag.

data.title: Touring the circle area
data.text:
It was an awfully hot day, I was just looking for Airconditioning & water the Chocolate Cafe was a fantastic find!!! Although it is small, the staff is very kind & accommodating! They had items to eat for lunch & of course luscious chocolate goodies.
If you get the chance stop by, you won't be disappointed.

data.title: Cheese Cake is Tasty
data.text: The cafe only serve hot choclate and on the day that I went there, it's really hot so I decided that I need cold drinks so I ordered ice coffee instead. I tried blueberry cheese cake and it is so good.

data.title: Nice afternoon treat
data.text: My husband, parents and I stopped here for a cool afternoon treat. There were 28 flavors of ice cream to choose from and the staff were friendly and offered as many samples as we wanted. The portions were huge and it was fun to sit outside and enjoy the people watching in monument circle.

data.title: Yummy handmade chocolates
data.text: There were lots of chocolate choices  Great place for dessert (hot chocolate in winter).  It was a little small so it got crowded with only one person waiting on people at the chocolate counter.  Chocolates ended up costing approximately $1 each.  They also serve ice cream which people seemed to be enjoying, but we were too busy picking out chocolates to try any.

data.title: Mesmerizing Cakes and Cheese Cake on a Stick
data.text: One of the cute shops on the circle that is worthwhile for your sweet tooth. The cafe has something for everyone from truffles to ice cream. If you are looking for a cool Halloween basket, this is a great place to grab one. Or if you are seeking simple but elegant chocolate gifts, there are many to choose from. The cakes are YUGE...seriously, one piece could feed 4 people. No kidding.

data.title: tasty chocolats
data.text: walking around monument circle we saw this place and gave it a try. kinda small but had good candy and cakes.

data.title: Great Place for Dessert
data.text: My family spent the day at the Children's Museum and we wanted to get some dessert.  When you walk in you see all the chocolate, but go to the back and they have the cakes.  We got a white and dark chocolate mousse cake, a caramel cake and a piece of chocolate cake.  We did notice a piece of 7 layer cake which was really made of 7 layers that looked like it could feed a party of 6 more.  The desserts were very good and we enjoyed it greatly.  It's basically a simple cafe type and worth the visit.

data.title: unimpressed
data.text: Had read the reviews prior to going here so was looking forward to it. The place looked amazing, the chocolate displays looked great, the cakes looked delicious and the options available to choose from were vast. However the coffee tasted horrible, the cake looked better than it tasted and the man serving us was so rude and arrogant that we couldn't eat and drink quick enough to get out of there! I could have coped with the coffee and cake being a bit naff had the service been good but it was shocking, he behaved like he was angry and in a vile mood. Very disappointing. We would rather have stayed outside in the cold!

data.title: Great covered rice-krispy treats!
data.text: Stopped in while walking monument circle and grabbed a couple of treats for the kids.  Expensive yes, but very good and worth a look.

data.title: Great place at  the monument circle
data.text: It is a cute cafe where you can sip some coffee or buy some chocolate. The best feature is their bear figure that is great in the pictures. We love the place a lot.

data.title: Great icecream
data.text: Good flavored. I had the salted caramel and toffee and both were great. Serve a huge cup for $4. Had to look for the person to serve but once I found him it was ok

data.title: Yum! – And an Excellent Value
data.text: Located along the southwestern quadrant of Monument Circle, the Chocolate Café is an excellent place to get a treat and enjoy it while sitting outside along the wonderful atmosphere of Monument Circle, the center of activity in Indianapolis.  While this place certainly was very busy, like everything else along Monument Circle, on Friday and Saturday evenings, we found the lines to be much more reasonable at other times.  We got huge, four-scoop, hot fudge sundaes, more than enough for two to share, that were delicious and a real value at only $6.  We will be saving room for a stop here whenever we visit downtown Indy from now on.

data.title: So Yummy, but Long Lines
data.text: Stopped by on a Sunday evening around 9pm, and the line was nearly out the door. It seemed like they were short-staffed. The gentleman who served us was fantastic though. He was very patient with my two kids, offering them samples to help them decide. Giant malt ball in the bottom of my cone was a fun surprise. Delicious treat on a warm summer evening.

data.title: Great Service,  wide variety of things to purchase
data.text: I stopped in to see what they had, and got more than I expected.  From ice cream to frozen yogurt to novelties and beyond.  The one thing that I didn't expect was how old their individual chocolate looked.  I purchased a huge pecan turtle for a little less than $5, and it was great.  Service was excellent.  I wish now I had asked why their individual chocolates looked like they had been in the case for a month!!!

data.title: Waiting for too long - is it worth it?
data.text: Are you planning to go there on Saturday evening? Please, don't. It's so messy, there is a huge line of people, trying to get a cup of chocolate and piece of cake. You will have to wait for around half an hour to get your desired goodies. We did not even manage to get what we wanted - we just went out after 20 minute of waiting. Maybe their cakes and coffee are really that good - we will try to get one next time in less busy hours.
